greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lower triangular region of A231713; A triangular table read by rows: T(n,k) = sum of absolute values of digit differences in the factorial base representations (A007623) of n and k, where (n, k) = (0,0), (1,0), (1,1), (2,0), (2,1), (2,2), ..., n >= 0 and (0 <= k <= n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Rows n = 0..120 of triangle, flattened
formula: a(n) = A231713(A003056(n),A002262(n)). [As a sequence, this is obtained by taking a subsection from array A231713.]
example: Please see A231713 for examples how the terms are computed.
program: (define (A231713bi x y) (let loop ((x x) (y y) (i 2) (d 0)) (cond ((and (zero? x) (zero? y)) d) (else (loop (floor->exact (/ x i)) (floor->exact (/ y i)) (+ i 1) (+ d (abs (- (modulo x i) (modulo y i)))))))))
xref: This is a lower, or equivalently, an upper triangular subregion of symmetric square array A231713. Cf. A230417.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 12 2013
